title: INHERITANCE – Special screening + Q&A
description: Friday, January 24 at 7:20 p.m.: Q&A with director Neil Burger When Maya (Phoebe Dynevor) learns her father Sam (Rhys Ifans) was once a spy, she suddenly finds herself at the center of an international conspiracy. title: Hard Hat Riot
description: Tuesday, September 16 at 7:00: Q&A with directors Marc Levin and Daphne Pinkerson and film subjects Mikaela Beardsley, Cary Woods, Cameo George and David Paul Kuhn after the screening On May 8, 1970, “the Hard Hat Riot” erupted in lower Manhattan. title: Ain’t No Back to a Merry-Go-Round
description: Wednesday, September 17 and Thursday, September 18 at 6:30: Q&As with filmmakers Saturday, September 20 and Sunday, September 21 at 1:30: Q&As with filmmakers AIN’T NO BACK TO A MERRY-GO-ROUND is the untold story of the first organized interracial civil rights protest in U.S. history. title: Dawson City: Frozen Time
description: Tuesday, September 30 at 6:55: Q&A with director Bill Morrison after the screening Bill Morrison (Decasia, The Great Flood) pieces together the bizarre history of a collection of 500 films from the 1910s and 20s, lost until they were unearthed from a subarctic swimming pool deep in the Yukon Territory in 1978. title: Cameraperson
description: Sunday, September 28 at 4:05: Q&A with director Kristen Johnson after the screening What does it mean to film someone? How does it affect the subject—and what does it do to the filmer? Johnson, the cinematographer behind such essential documentaries as Citizenfour, Farenheit 9/11, The Invisible War and dozens more, draws on the remarkable footage she’s shot throughout her […]

title: Milestone Films: A 35th Anniversary Celebration in 35mm
description: Founded in 1990 by industry veterans and devoted cinephiles Amy Heller and Dennis Doros, Milestone Films has always been a labor of love. The couple’s passion for discovering both new voices and unsung classics drove them to distribute work from all over the world, spanning the entire history of moving pictures, with a special focus […]
